context.apps
Class ContextModel

java.lang.Object
  context.apps.ContextModel
Direct Known Subclasses:
AccelerometerModel, AutostatusModel, HelloRoom, HomeModel, RoomModel
public class ContextModel
extends java.lang.Object

Use this class as the focal point of a context-aware application. Extend it to add Widgets and Enactors to the model so that contexts and logic are modeled. Then call #start() to launch the Widgets and Enactors so that they automatically loads the components in their own threads.

Nested Class Summary
static interface ContextModel.EnactorsReadyListener
          Used to listen to when the initialization of widgets, and then enactors are done, so that the context model is ready.

Field Detail

LOGGER

protected static org.apache.log4j.Logger LOGGER

DISCOVERER_LOAD_DELAY

protected static final long DISCOVERER_LOAD_DELAY
Time delay in msec to let widgets start up before having enactors reference them. Value is empirically derived, and may differ across applications. Make the value larger if you find the application stalling.

pause

protected static void pause(long delay)

addWidget

public void addWidget(Widget widget)
Add widget to the application so that it will enqueue to start when start() is called. Do not prematurely start the widget by calling @Widget.findDiscoverer before adding.

Parameters:
widget -

addEnactor

public void addEnactor(Enactor enactor)
Add enactor to the application so that it will enqueue to start when start() is called. Do not prematurely start the widget by calling @Enactor.startAll before adding.

Parameters:
enactor -

addGenerator

public void addGenerator(Generator generator)
Add generator to the application so that it will enqueue to start when start() is called. Do not prematurely start the widget by calling @Generator.startAll before adding.

Parameters:
generator -
See Also:
addGenerator(Generator)

startDiscoverer

public static boolean startDiscoverer()
This would be called if the application also starts the discoverer internally. Alternatively, it can be called independently of this application to start the Discoverer to this runtime. Starts the discoverer in its own thread so that it won't block any other toolkit component. This does not start the discoverer if it is already started.

Returns:
false if the discoverer is already started.

startDiscoverer

public static boolean startDiscoverer(int port)

stopDiscoverer

public static boolean stopDiscoverer()

isDiscovererStarted

public static boolean isDiscovererStarted()

startWidgets

protected void startWidgets()
Starts widgets, each in its own thread. This is necessary so that they don't block any other toolkit component.

startEnactors

protected void startEnactors()
Starts enactors, each in its own thread. This is necessary so that they don't block any other toolkit component.

public void setEnactorsReadyListener(ContextModel.EnactorsReadyListener listener)
